thread.title: Ryan Mason pleased to see teammate Michael Dawson as Hull midfielder recovers from skull surgery
thread.title_full: Ryan Mason pleased to see teammate Michael Dawson as Hull midfielder recovers from skull surgery

author: mirror
title: Ryan Mason pleased to see teammate Michael Dawson as Hull midfielder recovers from skull surgery
text:
Ryan Mason pleased to see teammate Michael Dawson as Hull midfielder recovers from skull surgery Mason suffered a serious head injury after a horrific collision with Chelsea defender Gary Cahill Share Ryan Mason suffered a serious head injury (Photo: TGSPhoto/REX/Shutterstock) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Ryan Mason was pleased to see Hull captain Michael Dawson as he continues his recovery from surgery. 
Today, as well as Dawson and dad Glen, the club's doctor as well as the club secretary and his agent all paid a visit. 
And club manager Marco Silva visited but went back to Hull last night. Read More Michael Dawson visited Mason in hospital (Photo: Tony Marshall) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Share this video Watch Next 
Leaving the hospital after a 45 minute visit, a Hull City club doctor, dressed in a full club tracksuit, said: "He's good. He was delighted to see us. 
"Marco Silva the manager went back to Hull last night but all the medical staff stayed down. 
"The team captain Michael Dawson, the club secretary, the physio and his dad were here today." 
The doctor refused to comment further on his condition or whether he had suffered a bleed to his brain. Read More Mason and Gary Cahill clash heads (Photo: AFP/Getty) The Hull midfielder lies injured on the pitch (Photo: Reuters) 
A man who said he was Mason's agent said the player was "happy to see everyone" but wouldn't comment further. 
The 25-year-old had emergency surgery to his fractured skull last night. 
This morning the group of five men were seen arriving at the hospital, with Dawson dressed in club colours. 
Cahill, Chelsea club captain John Terry and assistant boss Steve Holland had previously been at the hospital on Sunday evening to check on Mason's well-being. 
It is understood the trio spent time with the player's family, who had attended the game. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
